result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby J Bolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Attorney to petition court for any sentence credit.
Credit For Time Served 3 Days.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign medical release for agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Obtain a valid driver's license within 120 days. Maintain/obtain full time employment and schooling. 
Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. To Report 03/31/15 by noon. Huber may transfer to Milwaukee County, only if defendant is in custody.
Defendant to perform 20 HOURS of community service for EACH Year of probation, with the last 20 hours in the 3rd year to be completed by the 10th month.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Count 8

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015, as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bobby J Bolden in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing argument by Intern Becky Van Dam and Atty. Perkins.  

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 8

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

 1 Year Jail Straight Time (Credit - 0 days)  Atty. Perkins has 10 days to write to the court regarding credit.  State to have 10 days to respond.

Term of Probation: 3 Years - Can be transferred to Milwaukee County.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Obtain a valid license within 120 days;
- Perform  20 hours of community service each year of probation with the last 20 hours in the 3rd year to be completed by the 10th month;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment and schooling.

Costs: $243.00   BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00  BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Sample waived

Condition Time: 30 days Huber -  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Defendant to report to Huber by noon on 3-31-15.  Court authorizes Huber to transfer to Milwaukee County only if the defendant is in custody.

COUNT 9

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

 3 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  Consecutive to COUNT 8
- 1 Year 6 months of Initial Confinement
-  1 Year 6 months of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years CONCURRENT TO COUNT 8

Conditions of Probation:  SAME AS COUNT 8

Costs: $268.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
DNA SAMPLE ORDERED if not already provided.

(Costs and Surchages to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 9-1-15)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations or pending actions.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Sentencing hearing on March 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 8 and 9.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 6 and 7 are dismissed and read in.
